TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, Beale said:

Well without further ado, here is the inital GitHub commit of TantaresSP, that is, Tantares - Space Probes.
A new mod focusing compltely on robotic lunar / interplanetary exploration.

https://github.com/Tantares/TantaresSP

As ever, this mod has no dependencies, but I will be looking to integrate with DMOS, or BDB if you have them installed - to share experiment definitions.

Few things still need to be configured, such as the cosmic ray detector, but the ion trap experiment is fully implemented, but a little basic.
Right now you can create a generic 1MV spacecraft, but neither Mars 1M or Venera 1VA exactly, yet.

More to come while I learn with rigging an unfurling antenna.

Tentative mod plans:

  • 1MV
  • 3MV
  • 4MV
  • Prop-M
  • Special eggs
  • Special washing machines
  • Cats?!?!
  • Cars?!?!
  • Spikey bois
  • Luna?
  • Fobos?


nice!
Decided nonmongo to experiment with Buran, what do you think has become more interesting?

And what about the details? They just ask to add them.
But will there be such a spherical, unfolding apparatus? And isn't it better to make it in the form of an empty cantainer, so that the player himself can put the modules he needs there?

Flight testing, antenna can break off by aerodynamic forces.

Ideally camera will be configured to produce red, green, and blue images separately, you can then stack these in your image editor of choice to get something like the bottom image, if things are moving fast.

On 8/9/2020 at 2:59 AM, prinjrius said:

Decided nonmongo to experiment with Buran

I, also, have been experimenting with Buran.

My literal first attempt at flying the Soviet Burya space shuttle. The orbiter is a Tunguska-Avalanche (craft file https://kerbalx.com/Flakbadger/Tungus...) from Flakbadger at Kerbal X. I added a 16-seat passenger compartment and rebalanced the RCS. Then instead of his stock Energia launcher, I built a new one with Tantares parts. The launch was a little squirrely because I did a roll to get a lower inclination but otherwise didn't have too many problems getting to orbit. It looks like a 200 km orbit is it's operational altitude. The added passenger module cuts down the on orbit dV from 500 m/s to about 350 m/s.
 
Coming back, I reentered a little steep and and exploded the nose cone. I also overshot my runway. (Hey, it's only my third reentry of a spaceplane ever). Mis-staged the landing parachute (I'll need to work on action groups). I then had my jet engines running, trying to get control, which I couldn't until I was well below 5000 meters (rereading the craft description would have told me that). At that point, I had expended too much fuel to get back to the runway and put down on the steppes. And was surprised when it didn't explode.
 
Not bad for a first flight.

GitHub

https://github.com/Tantares/TantaresSP

Little tweaks to 1MV, and the new antenna.
Still no propulsion.
